feed.title: GitHub Haskell Daily Trending
feed.subtitle: Daily Trending of Haskell in GitHub

entry.title: GaloisInc/LoCo
entry.summary:
LoCo : Location Constraints, Optimal, Pear : DSLs for optimal parsing

LoCo

LoCo, originally short for Location Constraints, now represents a collection of tooling for designing and reasoning about parsing, formats, and computation in general.

The most modern tooling here is:

  • optimal: tooling for on-demand, cached DAGs of computation
  • pear: tooling for defining parsers based on document "regions"

Older work can be found in:

  • locc: early efforts towards static format/parser reasoning

Acknowledgements

This material is based upon work supported by the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) under Contract No. HR001119C0076.

entry.title: donatello/TicTacToe
entry.summary:
A simple TicTacToe program to learn Haskell

This toy program is just to learn Haskell. It pits an AI TicTacToe player against the user.

The program requires the Haskell NCurses binding to be installed.

To run the program just execute (assuming all dependencies are installed):

$ ghc --make TicTacToe.hs $ ./TicTacToe
